DISTRICTS

ANANTNAG

Anantnag District, located in the southern sector of the Jehlum Valley, is celebrated for its rejuvenating climate, majestic mountains, melodious waters, fertile soil, fragrant flora, and delicious fruits. Geographically, it spans from 33o-20′ to 34o-15′ north latitude and 74o-30′ to 75o-35′ east longitude. The southern and eastern sectors bordering Jammu province's Reasi, Banihal, and Kishtwar tehsils, as well as Ladakh's Kargil tehsil, are defined by thick forests and rugged mountains

VERINAG
STREAMS

Verinag on the road to Jammu is another spring of great importance and beauty with deep blue water which also issues from the bottom of high scarp of a mountain spur and here again Jehangir built a pleasure garden and a summer house.

DIVINE
BEAUTY!

An octagonal pavement has been raised around the spring by the Emperor Jehangir. The Emperor was infatuated with the beauty of Verignag to the extent that while breathing his last at Chengas village near Rajouri he wished to be buried at Verinag.

LIFELINE
OF

INDIAN CRICKET

Cricket is the lifeline of Indians and bats are the lifeline of Cricket. Anantnag presents the best bats our cricketers ever held made from India's own KASHMIRI WILLOW

TRADITIONS
KEPT ALIVE

Kashmiri Willow bats are not only loved worldwide but Anantnag itself have ages old tradition with the sport itself. These hand-made bats helped numerous players to score both their first and last century.

KASHMIRI
TROUT

These exotic Trouts which are exclusive only to kashmiri waters are gauranteed as healthy as tasty. And yes you can eat it everyday!

Taste to
die for

Not only Kashmiri spices but the heavenly dishes created by these are seriously, man's most beautiful creation. Anantnag is especially known for it's KASHMIRI FISH CURRY.
